thread.title: HS football with Da Blitz - Sat, Oct 3, 2015
thread.title_full: HS football with Da Blitz - Sat, Oct 3, 2015

title: HS football with Da Blitz - Sat, Oct 3, 2015
text:
HS football with Da Blitz - Sat, Oct 3, 2015 UPDATED 9:22 PM HST Oct 03, 2015 Da Blitz: Scores from Sat, Oct 3, 2015 1 of 9 
Farrington locks up the OIA Blue Division's No. 2 seed & first round bye with a 21-14 win over Campbell. Previous Next 
Rain or shine, it's time for "Da Blitz" where we give you a weekly rundown on the high school football games you couldn’t go to. Related 
Click here to get last night's scores and a review of the games. 
This week, the Farrington Governors locked up the OIA Blue Division's No. 2 seed with a 21-14 win over the Campbell Sabers. 
Standout player of the night was running back Challen Fa'amatau who had 24-carries for 108-yards, all three of Farrington's touchdowns. 
Games that weren't so standout were McKinley vs. Castle and Anuenue vs. Waialua. 
McKinley and Anuenue were forced to forfeit their scheduled games – again – due to the lack of healthy bodies to field their teams. This is the eight straight week for Na Koa at 0-9 this season. 
On the Garden Isle, the Kapa’a Warriors had their best night with a 28-0 win over Waimea. The Warriors continue to roll in KIF, having shutout league opponents for 16 straight quarters this season. 
On the Big Island, the Waiakea Warriors were also able to prevent their opponents from scoring in their 30-0 win over Kea'au. 
More information will be updated as the games are being completed. 
(Remaining: Kahuku vs. Waianae, KS-Maui vs. King Kekaulike) 
Meanwhile in Idaho, something that hasn't happened in 49 years – three shutout losses by the UH football team in the same season. 
The last time a Hawaii team was blanked three times was in 1966, losing to University of Portland, Utah State, and Air Force. UH outscored 143-to-nothing in those shutouts. 
This year, with donuts against top-ranked Ohio State, Wisconsin, and now Boise State, points total to 121-to-none. Final score to Boise State: 55-0. 
Rainbow Warriors fall to 2-3 overall, 0-1 in the Mountain West. 
Next, they return home to host San Diego State for homecoming.
